name.text: Calculating the Volume of Material in a Hollow Cylinder

questiontext.text:
A hollow cylindrical pipe has an outer radius of \({@R@}\,\text{m}\), an inner radius of \({@r@}\,\text{m}\) and a length of \({@h@}\,\text{m}\).
Calculate the volume of material used to make the pipe.

\(\text{Volume of the pipe}=\)[[input:ans1]]\(\,\text{m}^3\)[[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Given:

Outer radius: \({@R@}\,\text{m}\)

Inner radius: \({@r@} \,\text{m}\)

Length of the pipe: \({@h@} \,\text{m}\)

Step 1: Compute the volume of the outer cylinder

\(\begin{align} V_\text{Outer} &= \pi R^2 h \\ &= 3.142 \times {@R@}^2 \times {@h@} \\ &={@V_Outer@}\,\text{m}^3 \end{align}\)

Step 2: Compute the volume of the inner cylinder

\(\begin{align} V_\text{Inner} &= \pi r^2 h \\ &= 3.142 \times {@r@}^2 \times {@h@}\\ &={@V_Inner@}\,\text{m}^3 \end{align}\)

Step 3: Subtract inner volume from outer volume to get the hollow cylinder volume

\(\begin{align} V &= V_\text{Outer} - V_\text{Inner} \\ &= {@V_Outer@}-{@V_Inner@}\\ &={@V_1@}\,\text{m}^3 \end{align}\)

questionnote.text:
\(\text{The radius of the inner pipe}={@r@}\,\text{m}\)

\(\text{The radius of outer pipe}={@R@}\,\text{m}\)

\(\text{The length of the pipe}={@h@}\,\text{m}\)

\(\text{The Volume of the pipe}={@V_1@}\,\text{m}^3\)
